page.title: 19Hookshouse Pottery.
page.content: The only retail outlet in the tiny hamlet of Hookshouse is a pottery which is housed in a row of low buildings next to a cottage.The potter lives in the cottage.He has his own kiln at the pottery and even makes his own wood-ash glaze.Most of his products are well-designed and attractively produced items of table-ware.These can be viewed and/or bought from the gallery/shop which adjoins the pottery.This building itself is of some interest.It was originally built for raising game birds for the local landowner.The niches which were used for this purpose now make an attractive display area for the stone-ware mugs and jugs.
